body:
This looks more like a support request than a clear bug or feature request. Please use the forum - https://forum.syncthing.net/ - for support, first by searching for any similar issues and then by posting a new one when required. The forum has a lot more eyes and friendly people on it than the issue tracker.

Thanks!

Nah this is a actually a legit bug. The lock file is in the database directory, which may not be created yet if it's not the same as the config directory; I can reproduce. I suspect Arch sets the env vars to trigger xdg fundamentalist mode with separation of config and database dirs by default.

```
testuser@unu:~$ syncthing serve --data ~/.local/foo/bar --config ~/.local/baz/quux
[start] 2025/05/25 05:51:42 INFO: syncthing v2.0.0-rc.16 "Hafnium Hornet" (go1.24.2 linux-amd64) debian@github.syncthing.net 2025-05-20 12:34:20 UTC [noupgrade]
[start] 2025/05/25 05:51:42 INFO: Generating ECDSA key and certificate for syncthing...
[start] 2025/05/25 05:51:42 WARNING: Failed to acquire lock: open /home/testuser/.local/foo/bar/syncthing.lock: no such file or directory
[monitor] 2025/05/25 05:51:42 INFO: Syncthing exited: exit status 1
^C[monitor] 2025/05/25 05:51:43 INFO: Signal 2 received; exiting
```

body: This happens on Debian as well with a fresh install of syncthing from the Debian apt repositories (version 1.29.5)

Sure, because the fix is shipped with v1.29.7 and the Debian version is lagging behind.

Add https://apt.syncthing.net to your sources if you need a recent version.
